In anatomy, a 'process' (), or 'apophysis', is a projection or outgrowth of
tissue from a larger body. Dorland's Medical Dictionary For instance
in a vertebra, a process may serve for muscle attachment and leverage (as in the
case of the transverse and spinous processes), or to fit (forming a synovial
joint), with another vetebra (as in the case of the articular
processes). Moore, Keith L. et al. (2010) Clinically Oriented Anatomy, 6th
Ed, p.442 fig. 4.2
